column1: The free COVIDaware MN app notifies you if you have been near someone who tests positive for COVID-19: https://t.co/3nSGbVTqGI  Read more about how it works & how it protects users’ privacy: https://t.co/4YK0JQI3Su

@GovTimWalz & the MN legislature are taking action on additional COVID relief. But much more is needed – underscoring the failure of Trump & Republicans to work in good faith with @HouseDemocrats to pass another federal aid package. https://t.co/kM5jlOK3y9
Wondering whether you should get tested for COVID-19? @mnhealth has updated recommendations for who should get a test during the #DialBackMN period: https://t.co/7QLktqkqFc

Coronavirus cases are increasing at an alarming pace in Minnesota and our hospitals are on the verge of dangerous capacity shortages. These measures will help us #StaySafeMN and get this surge under control ⬇ https://t.co/XmfupVDEt9
As COVID becomes more widespread and deadly in Minnesota these restrictions are necessary. It’s on all of us to do what we can to stop the spread.

3000+ Minnesotans have now died from COVID-19. 67 deaths just in the last day – another new record.  Hospital and ICU beds are filling up across the state.  Each of us needs to take precautions & hunker down to prevent more tragedy.

White Bear Lake and other communities across the Twin Cities are coming together to support local restaurants and commit to COVID-19 safety measures – which helps restaurants & residents alike. https://t.co/YxxVJD9upd

COVID-19 is on everyone’s mind right now but don’t forget that flu season is upon us too! Now more than ever we need to do everything we can to stay healthy. Find out where you can get your flu shot if you haven’t already. ⬇ https://t.co/MJJLlQf2Ic

Pres. Trump's refusal to begin a peaceful presidential transition is endangering millions of Americans as we struggle with a surge in COVID-19 cases. More lives will be needlessly lost if Trump continues to deny Pres-elect Biden updated COVID data. https://t.co/zHJWMfFsDS

This #AmericanEducationWeek I want to thank all our teachers faculty and staff who educate and support our students – and reiterate my commitment to providing additional federal funding for our school systems to ensure learning can be done safely amidst the #COVID19 crisis.

With cases on the rise in Minnesota make sure you have health insurance coverage if you get COVID-19. Open enrollment is happening now at https://t.co/9PwEa4zeKC. Don’t wait to #GetCovered! https://t.co/ApcRBe8NiY
.@mnhealth is encouraging all Minnesotans ages 18-35 to get a free COVID-19 test. More testing sites are opening across the state and at-home testing is available too. https://t.co/IZ8pjrcO1D

I'm glad these #CARESAct funds will be used to ensure Minnesotans using SNAP benefits are able to choose curbside pickup or delivery for their groceries. All Minnesotans should be able to take the COVID-19 precautions they need to stay safe. https://t.co/ws6RqZ6vTW

#COVID19 jeopardizes decades of progress and U.S. investment in global child health and survival. This #ChildHealthWeek let’s recommit to working together to preserve these gains & continue saving lives.
At-home COVID-19 testing is now available for Minnesotans anywhere in the state – with or without symptoms at no cost.   Learn how to order your test kit here ⬇ https://t.co/yPhLhOqbay

President-elect Biden has announced a coronavirus task force that includes our fellow Minnesotan Dr. Osterholm and other experts who will provide a strong science-based strategy to combat this pandemic nationwide. https://t.co/PdJQjeiQMe

Scam alert! People have reported receiving fraudulent text messages claiming to need bank information to receive COVID-19 economic impact payments. If you get one of these texts do not click the link – instead report it to the IRS. Learn more here: https://t.co/EjbYqfIZiJ
Need a COVID-19 test? Free testing is available every day of the week at Roy Wilkins Auditorium in St. Paul. Learn more & make an appointment: https://t.co/a18T59NqVs

I held a call with @MNhospitals this morning for an update on COVID-19. In the midst of everything else the virus is spreading quickly in MN. Our hospitals are meeting this challenge but we can’t let up – it's on us to keep wearing a mask & social distancing to stop the spread.

Free COVID-19 saliva testing will be available at Roy Wilkins Auditorium in St. Paul starting today. Weekday hours are 12pm to 7pm and weekend hours are 10am to 4pm. Here’s what you need to know: https://t.co/GYmxxK7jg6

I’m glad to see this commitment from Dr. Marks at @US_FDA to ensuring the development of a COVID-19 vaccine is done with integrity so the American people can trust that it is safe and effective. https://t.co/YZJcXhMFAb

As we in MN struggle with a COVID-19 surge and new cases are at record highs across America Pres. Trump considers "ending the COVID-19 pandemic" as one of his first-term accomplishments.    He continues to fail at taking this virus seriously. https://t.co/V2cA4Gtize

Coronavirus cases are on the rise in Minnesota so don't let COVID fatigue settle in – I echo @GovTimWalz’s call to stay vigilant about wearing a mask physical distancing and avoiding large crowds to stop the spread of COVID-19. Let's #MaskUpMN! https://t.co/mkpqOlocMm

This Thursday (Oct. 29) and Friday (Oct. 30) from 2-6pm free COVID-19 testing is available in St. Paul – no insurance or ID required. Find more details & sign up for an appointment here: https://t.co/celKjrbcuN

I commend @SenAmyKlobuchar & @SenTinaSmith for opposing Trump’s extreme SCOTUS nominee. @SenateGOP rushed through a sham process while ignoring the unprecedented COVID-19 crisis devastating American families.

“White House gives up on trying to slow virus’s spread.”   “We’re not going to control the pandemic.”  “It is what it is.”  Republicans are waving the white flag on stopping COVID– but @HouseDemocrats know Americans can't just give up. We'll keep fighting. https://t.co/82pjoQWnu2

Many local nonprofits have helped families who are struggling due to the pandemic. @newbrightonmn has now opened up its COVID-19 grant relief programs to these organizations using federal #CARESAct dollars. https://t.co/xy62AKASj8

SNAP benefits are vital to support families in need of food assistance. Thank you Hmong American Partnership for helping to get these benefits into the hands of those who need them – especially during COVID-19. https://t.co/tKOIAWLaTP

Tribal leaders are working to protect their nations as new COVID-19 cases among Native Americans in Minnesota grew by about 75% in the past month. Health inequities & other disparities are being exacerbated by the pandemic – let's continue to #MaskUpMN! https://t.co/Er0PMbbCzu

The COVID-19 pandemic threatens to erase economic gains made by women over the past several decades. The House did its part to help working mothers with the #HeroesAct – the Senate must do its job and take action. #momsbailout

.@senatemajldr is urging Trump to oppose a COVID relief bill because “any deal they reach could disrupt the Senate’s plans to confirm Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court." He cares more about rushing through this confirmation than saving American lives. https://t.co/e3mO6X7Rx1
“Cultural brokers” like Kacher act as liaisons connecting members of the Karen community to resources to help them navigate schools health care and now – COVID-19. https://t.co/gxfiR6EnCg

Once again Pres. Trump is choosing to attack our leading scientists rather than actually addressing COVID-19. Instead of disparaging heroes like Dr. Fauci Pres. Trump should listen to our medical experts and focus on how we can get out of this crisis. https://t.co/CZA5j8Yrjs
Happy 102nd birthday Raymund Hahn! I’m glad the community found a COVID-safe way to celebrate this Stillwater WWII veteran.  https://t.co/LJ62Od0Dia

Scientists agree that herd immunity is a "dangerous fallacy" that would lead to needless suffering & more deaths–yet the White House bolsters it as a real strategy. As MN & our nation grapple with a resurgence in COVID-19 cases we must follow the science. https://t.co/AXsLMmD7Ed

Congress passed #CARESAct earlier this year to help those impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. Cash assistance is now available for small businesses in St. Paul with a focus on live music venues movie theaters and food halls. Deadline to apply is Oct. 21. https://t.co/RZBv872QqD

Sad to hear a TSA agent from MSP Airport has died of COVID-19 – one of 8 agents to pass away from the virus nationwide. My thoughts & prayers are with his loved ones.   We need a proper testing tracing & treatment strategy to get the virus under control. https://t.co/mKm2Znpj5L

President Trump and Senate Republicans are racing to install a justice onto the Supreme Court in order to strike down the Affordable Care Act and destroy lifesaving protections for people with pre-existing conditions – including people infected by the coronavirus.

Still missing your #COVID19 Economic Impact Payment & don't normally file a tax return? The IRS has extended the deadline for non-filers to request their stimulus check until Nov. 21. Visit the IRS portal today to submit your info: https://t.co/FsqYsdOpFZ

A record number of COVID-19 cases were reported Saturday in Minnesota. This pandemic is still happening and it is serious.  Let’s all do our part to stay vigilant wear a mask and physically distance. https://t.co/aWJN5PpWPn

The White House’s latest coronavirus relief offer fails to acknowledge essential science-based solutions to contain the virus. It also overlooks the critical needs of state & local governments that provide essential services that so many Americans rely on. https://t.co/Mj4NRtawMF
$3 million in federal #CARESAct dollars will fund this initiative to support mental health services for children & families during the COVID-19 pandemic. #MentalHealthWeek https://t.co/yzJwxdg7RC

Great to see MN’s own Dr. @mtosterholm host a webinar with FDA Commissioner Stephen Hahn and former FDA Commissioner Margaret Hamburg to discuss the importance of a safe and thorough review process for a potential COVID-19 vaccine.   Watch here: https://t.co/ubyejfF8GJ

Pres. Trump’s decision to walk away from coronavirus talks demonstrates his disdain for our frontline heroes – health workers first responders teachers sanitation workers and others.   He and Congressional Republicans continue to put lives & livelihoods at risk.

The Chairman of the Federal Reserve again pleads with Congress to save the economy by passing additional COVID-19 emergency aid. @HouseDemocrats have done our part.    @SenateGOP: Pass the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/D6OsT6x98z

Marner Saw helped hundreds of refugee families start new lives in Minnesota & become citizens as a founder of the Karen Organization of MN. His death from complications of COVID-19 is a great loss for our community. My condolences go out to his loved ones. https://t.co/WzLB4rhi6p
Food shelves in the East Metro have really stepped up to serve our communities amid the changing needs presented by COVID-19. If you need food assistance help is available. https://t.co/PSwY14tNkt

I’m wishing a full recovery for all Americans including Pres. Trump and the First Lady who’ve been infected with the coronavirus. I hope my Republican colleagues from the Minnesota delegation are safe and healthy.  https://t.co/PDRffDs6bI

Thank you @NCAI1944 @NIHB1 & @NCUIH_Official for providing an update on the COVID-19 response in Indian Country & what's needed to keep people safe. The updated #HeroesAct will provide additional aid for health care first responders education & more in Native communities. https://t.co/HyvdoPwjxd

Congress has provided $1.1 billion to date to IHS & $500 million to BIA & BIE to address COVID-19 – but issues have arisen with the admin’s distribution of funds a lack of flexibility and the delay in additional relief.

Today I’ll lead the Interior-Environment @AppropsDems Subcommittee in hearing from @NCAI1944 @NIHB1 & @NCUIH_Official on the response to #COVID19. I’m committed to ensuring Indian Country has the resources needed to combat this pandemic.   Watch live: https://t.co/yq1exhqRDV

Need a COVID-19 test? Visit Aldrich Arena in Maplewood this week from 12-7pm Tuesday-Thursday (Sept. 29-Oct. 1); 1-6pm on Saturday (Oct. 3). You can get a free test with or without symptoms.   Schedule an appointment here: https://t.co/gYU0VD4brS

“Indigenous Impacts” a new special report series shines a light on the disproportionate effects of COVID-19 on Native American communities and tells the stories of resilient people meeting these challenges head on. https://t.co/rr5vrkheza

The @mnhs is reopening on Oct. 1 with exhibits on Prince & First Avenue! COVID-19 safety measures are in place. https://t.co/4mNBOtUsb1

According to local publishers the pandemic has led to a wave of new literary works & first-time authors – with more time at home & writing as a tool for expression & processing all that COVID-19 has brought to the surface. https://t.co/pyNpYaNPqA

This pandemic has had a disproportionate impact on minority communities exacerbating racial disparities. I signed on to co-sponsor H.R. 8192 which provides grants for community-based orgs & nonprofits to conduct #COVID19 testing tracing & outreach in these communities.

Gov. Walz has ordered flags flown at half-staff today September 19 in remembrance of the Minnesotans who have lost their lives from COVID-19. We honor them & mourn together with their loved ones. https://t.co/XQIN28hW07

.@HouseDemocrats are delivering #ForThePeople – but @senatemajldr is standing in the way. With COVID-19 threatening lives & livelihoods and people across the country standing up against racism the stakes are higher than ever. https://t.co/ordcRySMG5

The Fourth District is fortunate to be home to a large and vibrant Asian-American community. It’s wrong that here and across the country we’ve seen threats discrimination and even crimes based on bigoted and reckless anti-Asian rhetoric related to COVID-19.

COVID-19 and the economic crisis facing our entire country right now have been especially devastating for Indian Country. I joined @NCAI1944 to discuss with tribal leaders how we can work together to get much-needed resources and support to Native communities. #TUID2020 https://t.co/AllG6I7My8

COVID-19 is creating a childcare crisis that hits working families hard. The Sanneh Foundation has a creative solution to provide technology & structure for distance learning to East Side students who need it. https://t.co/N3nsS0Ly44

Black Indigenous & other communities of color are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19. I’m working with my fellow @AppropsDems to push for $50M in environmental justice grants to address connections between air pollution exposure & coronavirus. Pass the #HeroesAct now!

Proud to cosponsor the THRIVE Resolution to ensure that as we build back from the COVID-19 crisis we also address the intertwined crises of environmental racism & climate change and lay the foundation for a bright future for our communities & future generations. #TimeToThrive https://t.co/6wn6hDDLAd

Lacking a federal response from the White House & GOP Senate kids will fall behind teachers will be laid off and COVID-19 outbreaks will continue. This is unacceptable. @HouseDemocrats will continue fighting to keep students educators & families safe. https://t.co/axJyG71HC5

It also contains measures I worked on including: -Cosmetics safety for women of color -Tribal higher education & wellness programs -Changes to Strategic National Stockpile to improve public health emergency response -#CSBG funding for rapid #COVID19 relief to families in need

The package contains the FY 21 Labor-HHS-Education @AppropsDems bill which increases funding for public education health care & workforce training to strengthen our nation. It also makes critical investments to allow us to respond to COVID-19 & future pandemics.

Great to see over $1M #CSBG dollars come back to MN-04 in a recent grant. I have fought hard for this federal program because Community Action Agencies like @CAPRW provide boots-on-the-ground rapid response economic assistance efforts to help families in crisis due to #COVID19.
Starting tomorrow: #MaskUpMN. Face masks are highly effective at reducing transmission of #COVID19 and are essential to reopening our economy. We’re in this together! https://t.co/TJEAT97Yar

While there is much more work to do this bill makes progress towards upholding the federal government’s trust & treaty responsibilities to Native American communities increasing funding for BIA BIE & IHS.   #COVID19 has amplified the urgent need for these investments.

Millions of Americans have been left unemployed by COVID-19 and countless others are unable to safely return to the workplace. Federal unemployment benefits expire next week for approx 450000 Minnesotans if the Senate refuses to act. #PassTheHeroesAct https://t.co/yJ1kwFFEWw

Glad to see federal #CARESAct dollars reach Stillwater to help with #COVID19 response – funds that can be spent on medical expenses like PPE cleaning of city facilities technology costs public safety measures paid leave for employees and more. https://t.co/HSI6jV4h2W

And the bill provides $750 million for Community Action Agencies that serve rural urban and suburban communities across America providing vital & accessible services to meet the immediate needs of American families especially during #COVID19. #CSBG

I worked on changes to how we regulate & fund the Strategic National Stockpile – particularly how we maintain PPE supplies – and I’m pleased to see them included in this bill. This will ensure we are better equipped to combat #COVID19 as well as future public health emergencies.

This bill also rejects the Trump admin’s proposed elimination of the @ForestService International Program increasing funding for it & for @USFWSIntl. This will help combat poaching & wildlife trafficking & help reduce global transmission of zoonotic diseases like #COVID19.

I spoke to private & public college presidents today about the challenges that come with planning to deliver education while ensuring the health & safety of students faculty & staff – as well as the severe financial strain many higher ed institutions face because of #COVID19.
